title: Find the slope of the line that passes through the points $$(-2,0)$$ and $$(0,-3)$$.

The slope $$m$$ of a line passing through two points (x1,y1​) and (x2​,y2​) is given by the formula: $$m=\frac{y2-y1}{x2-x1}$$. Substituting points into the formula, what is the value of the slope $$m$$?
The point-slope form of a line is: $$y-y1=m(x-x1)$$. Using point $$(-2,0)$$ and slope $$m=\frac{-3}{2}$$, we can get the point-slope form of the line.
